definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

pinyin: fu2 she4 jing3 gao4 biao1 zhi4

sentences.english: I stand on my front feet and do a handstand to warn my enemies.
sentences.chinese: 当我警告敌人时，会立起前足倒立。

sentences.english: The guy warned me that you have to knock on the door first to scatter them away.
sentences.chinese: 店员警告我说开门前最好先敲敲门，以便把它们吓跑。

sentences.english: “The first was just a warning, ” Abrahim said.
sentences.chinese: “刚才第一次不过是警告，”亚伯拉罕说。

sentences.english: You can enter the Summary first to avoid the warning if you prefer.
sentences.chinese: 如果您愿意，您可以先进入摘要以避免产生警告。

sentences.english: The rich lode of Web data, experts warn, has its perils.
sentences.chinese: 专家警告称，网络数据数量巨大也有其弊端。

sentences.english: In Malaysia, officials have warned Muslims against celebrating.
sentences.chinese: 在马拉西亚，官方已经警告过穆斯林要反对庆祝了。

sentences.english: In fact, reporters had been warned beforehand about the potentially over-aggressive conduct.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，记者们在之前被警告过潜在的侵犯行为。

sentences.english: However, we may not be so fortunate in the future, experts warned.
sentences.chinese: 然而，专家警告，将来我们就不会这么幸运了。

sentences.english: They warn us of dangerous trends. They point out potent evils.
sentences.chinese: 他们为我们警告对危险倾向，指出潜在的邪恶。

sentences.english: Because Damon warned Isobel to stay away from her.
sentences.chinese: 因为D警告伊莎贝尔远离E。

sentences.english: The doctor warned her that her uterus might rupture if she lifted something heavy.
sentences.chinese: 医生警告她不要提重物，避免子宫破裂。

sentences.english: Do not suppress a warning from this rule.
sentences.chinese: 不要禁止显示此规则发出的警告。

sentences.english: The warning system was switched on halfway through the trial.
sentences.chinese: 这套警告系统在实验的中途被启动。

sentences.english: But Dobby had to come. Dobby has to protect Harry Potter. To warn him.
sentences.chinese: 可是多比非来不可，多比必须保护哈利波特，警告他。

definition: to remind/to call attention to/to warn of
to curb/to put a stop to/to stop/to check/to limit
